   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, the server being
   23: %% spread across three Erlang nodes.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_dist_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([
   33:          %% Framework functions
   34:          suite/0,
   35:          all/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38: 
   39:          %% The test cases
   40:          traffic/1
   41:         ]).
   42: 
   43: %% diameter callbacks
   44: -export([peer_up/3,
   45:          peer_down/3,
   46:          pick_peer/4,
   47:          prepare_request/3,
   48:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   49:          handle_answer/4,
   50:          handle_error/4,
   51:          handle_request/3]).
   52: 
   53: %% rpc calls
   54: -export([start/1,
   55:          call/1,
   56:          connect/1,
   57:          ping/1]).
   58: 
   59: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   60: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc6733.hrl").
   61: 
   62: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   63: 
   64: 
   65: %% ===========================================================================
   66: 
   67: -define(DL(F),    ?DL(F, [])).
   68: -define(DL(F, A), ?LOG("DDISTS", F, A)).
   69: 
   70: -define(CLIENT, 'CLIENT').
   71: -define(SERVER, 'SERVER').
   72: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
   73: -define(DICT, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
   74: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   75: 
   76: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   77: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   78:         [{'Origin-Host', Host ++ [$.|?REALM]},
   79:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
   80:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   81:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   82:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   83:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [?DICT:id()]},
   84:          {'Origin-State-Id', origin()},
   85:          {spawn_opt, {diameter_dist, route_session, [#{id => []}]}},
   86:          {sequence, fun sequence/0},
   87:          {string_decode, false},
   88:          {application, [{dictionary, ?DICT},
   89:                         {module, ?MODULE},
   90:                         {request_errors, callback},
   91:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
   92: 
   93: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
   94: -define(BUSY,    3004).
   95: -define(LOGOUT,  ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
   96: -define(MOVED,   ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
   97: -define(TIMEOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_SESSION_TIMEOUT').
   98: 
   99: -define(L, atom_to_list).
  100: -define(A, list_to_atom).
  101: 
  102: %% The order here is significant and causes the server to listen
  103: %% before the clients connect. The server listens on the first node,
  104: %% and distributes requests to the other two.
  105: -define(NODES, [{server0, ?SERVER},
  106:                 {server1, ?SERVER},
  107:                 {server2, ?SERVER},
  108:                 {client, ?CLIENT}]).
  109: 
  110: %% ===========================================================================
  111: %% common_test wrapping
  112: 
  113: suite() ->
  114:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  115: 
  116: all() ->
  117:     [traffic].
  118: 
  119: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  120:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  121: 
  122: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  123:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  124: 
  125: 
  126: traffic(Config) ->
  127:     ?DL("traffic -> entry"),
  128:     Factor = dia_factor(Config),
  129:     Res = do_traffic(Factor),
  130:     ?DL("traffic -> done when"
  131:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  132:     Res.
  133: 
  134: 
  135: %% ===========================================================================
  136: 
  137: %% run/0
  138: 
  139: run() ->
  140:     [] = ?RUN([{fun() -> do_traffic(1) end, 60000}]).
  141:     %% process for linked peers to die with
  142: 
  143: %% traffic/0
  144: 
  145: do_traffic(Factor) ->
  146:     ?DL("do_traffic -> check we have distribution"),
  147:     true = is_alive(),  %% need distribution for peer nodes
  148:     ?DL("do_traffic -> get nodes"),
  149:     Nodes = enslave(),
  150:     ?DL("do_traffic -> ping nodes (except client node)"),
  151:     [] = ping(lists:droplast(Nodes)),  %% drop client node
  152:     ?DL("do_traffic -> start nodes"),
  153:     [] = start(Nodes),
  154:     ?DL("do_traffic -> connect nodes"),
  155:     ok = connect(Nodes),
  156:     ?DL("do_traffic -> send (to) nodes"),
  157:     ok = send(Nodes, Factor),
  158:     ?DL("do_traffic -> done"),
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: %% enslave/1
  162: %%
  163: %% Start four slave nodes, three to implement a Diameter server,
  164: %% one to implement a client.
  165: 
  166: enslave() ->
  167:     Here = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  168:     Ebin = filename:join([Here, "..", "ebin"]),
  169:     Args = ["-pa", Here, Ebin],
  170:     [{N,S} || {M,S} <- ?NODES, N <- [start(M, Args)]].
  171: 
  172: start(Name, Args) ->
  173:     case ?PEER(#{name => Name, args => Args}) of
  174:         {ok, _, Node} ->
  175:             Node;
  176:         {error, Reason} ->
  177:             ?DL("Failed starting node ~p"
  178:                 "~n   Reason: ~p", [Name, Reason]),
  179:             exit({skip, {failed_starting_node, Name, Reason}})
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: 
  183: %% ping/1
  184: %%
  185: %% Ensure the server nodes are connected so that diameter_dist can attach.
  186: 
  187: ping({S, Nodes}) ->
  188:     ?SERVER = S,  %% assert
  189:     [N || {N,_} <- Nodes,
  190:           node() /= N,
  191:           pang <- [net_adm:ping(N)]];
  192: 
  193: ping(Nodes) ->
  194:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  195:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, ping, [{S,Nodes}])],
  196:                RC /= []].
  197: 
  198: %% start/1
  199: %%
  200: %% Start diameter services.
  201: 
  202: %% There's no need to start diameter on a node that only services
  203: %% diameter_dist as a handler of incoming requests, but the
  204: %% diameter_dist server must be started since the servers communicate
  205: %% to determine who services what. The typical case is probably that
  206: %% handler nodes also want to be able to send Diameter requests, in
  207: %% which case the application needs to be started and diameter_dist is
  208: %% started as a part of this, but only start the server here to ensure
  209: %% everything still works as expected.
  210: start({_SvcName, [_, {S1, _}, {S2, _}, _]})
  211:   when node() == S1;    %% server1
  212:        node() == S2 ->  %% server2
  213:     Mod = diameter_dist,
  214:     {ok, _} = gen_server:start({local, Mod}, Mod, _Args = [], _Opts  = []),
  215:     ok;
  216: 
  217: start({SvcName, [{S0, _}, _, _, {C, _}]})
  218:   when node() == S0;    %% server0
  219:        node() == C ->   %% client
  220:     ok = diameter:start(),
  221:     ok = diameter:start_service(SvcName, ?SERVICE((?L(SvcName))));
  222: 
  223: start(Nodes) ->
  224:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  225:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start, [{S, Nodes}])],
  226:                RC /= ok].
  227: 
  228: sequence() ->
  229:     sequence(sname()).
  230: 
  231: sequence(client) ->
  232:     {0,32};
  233: sequence(Server) ->
  234:     "server" ++ N = ?L(Server),
  235:     {list_to_integer(N), 30}.
  236: 
  237: origin() ->
  238:     origin(sname()).
  239: 
  240: origin(client) ->
  241:     99;
  242: origin(Server) ->
  243:     "server" ++ N = ?L(Server),
  244:     list_to_integer(N).
  245: 
  246: %% connect/1
  247: %%
  248: %% Establish one connection from the client, terminated on the first
  249: %% server node, the others handling requests.
  250: 
  251: connect({?SERVER, [{Node, _} | _], []})
  252:   when Node == node() ->  %% server0
  253:     [_LRef = ?LISTEN(?SERVER, tcp)];
  254: 
  255: connect({?SERVER, _, [_] = Acc}) -> %% server[12]: register to receive requests
  256:     ok = diameter_dist:attach([?SERVER]),
  257:     Acc;
  258: 
  259: connect({?CLIENT, [{Node, _} | _], [LRef]}) ->
  260:     ?CONNECT(?CLIENT, tcp, {Node, LRef}),
  261:     ok;
  262: 
  263: connect(Nodes) ->
  264:     lists:foldl(fun({N,S}, A) ->
  265:                         rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, connect, [{S, Nodes, A}])
  266:                 end,
  267:                 [],
  268:                 Nodes).
  269: 
  270: %% ===========================================================================
  271: %% traffic testcases
  272: 
  273: %% send/2
  274: %%
  275: %% Send 100 requests and ensure the node name sent as User-Name isn't
  276: %% the node terminating transport.
  277: 
  278: send(Nodes, Factor) ->
  279:     send(Nodes, 100, dict:new(), Factor).
  280: 
  281: %% send/2
  282: 
  283: send(Nodes, 0, Dict, _Factor) ->
  284:     ?DL("send(0) -> entry - verify stats"),
  285:     [{Server0, _} | _] = Nodes,
  286:     Node = atom_to_binary(Server0, utf8),
  287:     {false, _} = {dict:is_key(Node, Dict), dict:to_list(Dict)},
  288:     %% Check that counters have been incremented as expected on server0.
  289:     [Info] = rpc:call(Server0, diameter, service_info, [?SERVER, connections]),
  290:     {[Stats], _} = {[S || {statistics, S} <- Info], Info},
  291:     {[{recv, 1, 100}, {send, 0, 100}], _}
  292:         = {[{D,R,N} || T <- [recv, send],
  293:                        {{{0,275,R}, D}, N} <- Stats,
  294:                        D == T],
  295:            Stats},
  296:     {[{send, 0, 100, 2001}], _}
  297:         = {[{D,R,N,C} || {{{0,275,R}, D, {'Result-Code', C}}, N} <- Stats],
  298:            Stats},
  299:     ?DL("send(0) -> done"),
  300:     ok;
  301: 
  302: send(Nodes, N, Dict, Factor) ->
  303:     ?DL("send(~w) -> entry", [N]),
  304:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  305:                        'User-Name' = [ServerNode]}
  306:         = send(Nodes, str(?LOGOUT), Factor),
  307:     true = is_binary(ServerNode),
  308:     send(Nodes, N-1, dict:update_counter(ServerNode, 1, Dict), Factor).
  309: 
  310: 
  311: %% ===========================================================================
  312: 
  313: str(Cause) ->
  314:     #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm'   = ?REALM,
  315:                        'Auth-Application-Id' = ?DICT:id(),
  316:                        'Termination-Cause'   = Cause}.
  317: 
  318: %% send/3
  319: 
  320: send(Nodes, Req, Factor) ->
  321:     {Node, _} = lists:last(Nodes),
  322:     ?DL("send -> make rpc call (to call) to node ~p", [Node]),
  323:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, call, [{Req, Factor}]).
  324: 
  325: %% call/1
  326: 
  327: call({Req, Factor}) ->
  328:     Timeout = timeout(Factor),
  329:     ?DL("call -> make diameter call with"
  330:         "~n   Req:     ~p"
  331:         "~nwhen"
  332:         "~n   Timeout: ~w (~w)", [Req, Timeout, Factor]),
  333:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?DICT, Req, [{timeout, Timeout}]).
  334: 
  335: %% sname/0
  336: 
  337: sname() ->
  338:     ?A(hd(string:tokens(?L(node()), "@"))).
  339: 
  340: 
  341: %% ===========================================================================
  342: %% diameter callbacks
  343: 
  344: %% peer_up/3
  345: 
  346: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  347:     State.
  348: 
  349: %% peer_down/3
  350: 
  351: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  352:     State.
  353: 
  354: %% pick_peer/4
  355: 
  356: pick_peer([Peer], [], ?CLIENT, _State) ->
  357:     {ok, Peer}.
  358: 
  359: %% prepare_request/3
  360: 
  361: prepare_request(Pkt, ?CLIENT, {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  362:     #diameter_packet{msg = Req}
  363:         = Pkt,
  364:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  365:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  366:         = Caps,
  367:     {send, Req#diameter_base_STR{'Origin-Host' = OH,
  368:                                  'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  369:                                  'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH)}}.
  370: 
  371: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  372: 
  373: prepare_retransmit(_, ?CLIENT, _) ->
  374:     discard.
  375: 
  376: %% handle_answer/5
  377: 
  378: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  379:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  380:     Rec.
  381: 
  382: %% handle_error/5
  383: 
  384: handle_error(Reason, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  385:     {error, Reason}.
  386: 
  387: %% handle_request/3
  388: 
  389: handle_request(Pkt, ?SERVER, {_, Caps}) ->
  390:     #diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}}
  391:         = Pkt,
  392:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  393:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  394:         = Caps,
  395:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  396:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  397:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  398:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  399:                                'User-Name' = [atom_to_binary(node(), utf8)]}}.
  400: 
  401: 
  402: %% ===========================================================================
  403: 
  404: -define(CALL_TO_DEFAULT, 5000).
  405: timeout(Factor) when (Factor > 0) andalso (Factor =< 20) ->
  406:     (Factor - 1) * 500 + ?CALL_TO_DEFAULT;
  407: timeout(Factor) when (Factor > 0) ->
  408:     3*?CALL_TO_DEFAULT. % Max at 15 seconds
  409: 
  410: 
  411: %% ===========================================================================
  412: 
  413: dia_factor(Config) ->
  414:     config_lookup(?FUNCTION_NAME, Config).
  415: 
  416: config_lookup(Key, Config) ->
  417:     {value, {Key, Value}} = lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config),
  418:     Value.
